definition: to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: You're too weak;you'd better strengthen with rich food.
sentences.chinese: 你的身体太虚弱了，你得补养补养。

sentences.english: You're too weak;you'd better strengthen with rich food.
sentences.chinese: 你的身体太虚弱了，你得补养补养。

sentences.english: Q9. Natural vitamins are better supplements for the diet than synthetic vitamins.
sentences.chinese: 天然维生素同合成维生素相比，是更好的补养品。

sentences.english: Hmm, I have to do overtime again tonight. Time for a vitamin drink.
sentences.chinese: 哼，今晚又得加班，该喝维他命饮料补养补养了。

sentences.english: Hmm, I have to do overtime again tonight. Time for a vitamin drink.

sentences.english: Like other mammals, man nourishes his young with milk.
sentences.chinese: 像其他哺乳动物一样，人类也用乳汁补养后代。

definition: tonic food (food considered to be particularly healthful)/to eat such foods
to take care of (sb's health)/to nurse
to take a tonic (for one's health)
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
medicinal dietary supplement that helps build up one's health
to nurse one's health/to recuperate/to take care of/to look after/to discipline/to educate/to train/to prepare food/(dialect) to make fun of/(medicine) to opsonize
the benefits of medicine are not as great as those of good nutrition
pinyin: yao4 bu3 bu4 ru2 shi2 bu3

definition: to nourish one's skin/to maintain a youthful appearance
